subject: Re: [junit] Re: Another question about a JUnit test
msgSnippet: I think the original poster s point was that the test data required to test loadFile would be very similar to the test data required to test readFile.  This
messageBody:
I think the original poster's point was that the test data required to
test loadFile would be very similar to the test data required to test
readFile. This seems orthogonal to any question of whether one test
is dependent on another.

David Saff

2010/8/26 Cédric Beust ♔ <cedric@...>:
> On Thu, Aug 26, 2010 at 1:10 PM, tcdmail <tcdmail@...> wrote:
>
>> Just want to add a sidenote, suppose also that if you want to test
>> "readFile" you need to include almost all code from method "loadFile" in
>> order to be able to test everything
>>
>
> ... which is when test dependencies come in handy: you only need to run
> loadFile() once.
>
> --
> Cédric
>
